Title: Power Estimation Engineer - Hardware
Description:
NVIDIA is seeking a passionate, creative, and highly motivated engineer to work on architectural power estimation for the world’s leading GPUs and SOCs. In this position, the responsibility includes development of advanced power models to estimate power under various use cases. You are expected to understand the high-level architecture, application use-cases, process technology aspects which impact dynamic and leakage power, develop the estimation infrastructure and estimate power consumption under various scenarios. You will be working with architecture, design, synthesis, timing, circuit, and post silicon teams to accomplish your tasks.
This position offers the opportunity to have real impact in a dynamic, technology-focused company impacting product lines ranging from consumer graphics to self-driving cars and the growing field of artificial intelligence. We have crafted a team of outstanding people stretching around the globe, whose mission is to push the frontiers of what is possible today and define the platform for the future of computing. At NVIDIA, our employees are passionate about parallel and visual computing. We're united in our quest to transform the way graphics are used to solve some of the most complex problems in computer science.
The GPU started out as an engine for simulating human imagination, conjuring up the amazing virtual worlds of video games and Hollywood films. Today, NVIDIA’s GPU simulates human intelligence, running deep learning algorithms and acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world.
NVIDIA is increasingly known as “the AI computing company.”
What you’ll be doing:
Architecture, development and correlation of power estimation models/tools for NVIDIA's chips
Help architect and develop power models for use-case, leakage, and IO power
Chip in to design the tools based on these models and their testing methodology/infrastructures
Correlate and Calibrate these models using measured silicon data
Analyze and help decide the chip configuration and process technology options to optimize power/performance for Nvidia's upcoming chips
Help study and contribute to Performance/Watt improvement ideas for Nvidia's GPUs and SOCs
What we need to see:
B.Tech./M.Tech. with specialization/experience related to Power/Performance estimation techniques
2+ years of experience
Strong fundamentals in power including transistor-level leakage/dynamic characteristics of VLSI circuits
Familiarity with low power design techniques such as multi VT, Clock gating, Power gating, and Dynamic Voltage-Frequency Scaling (DVFS)
Strong background in power estimation techniques, flows, and algorithms
Good software programming skills. Python/C++ preferred. Good skills with object oriented programming and design.
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Exposure to lab setup including power measurement equipment such as scope/DAQ with ability to analyze board level power issues is a plus
Exposure to power analysis EDA tools such as PTPX/EPS
Good communication skills & desire to work as a great teammate
With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, Nvidia is widely considered to be one of the most desirable employers in the world. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Director, Team Manager
Description:
What makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage. You’ll deliver must-have research through compelling client interactions, and contribute to our double-digit growth by providing clients the unbiased insight and advice they need to make the right decisions every day. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration, you’ll help clients deliver on their mission-critical priorities, grow your career and increase your industry impact. We value hard workers — and reward you with unlimited opportunity. If you’re looking to explore what’s next in technology and business, Gartner is looking for you.
What makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you?
When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage. You’ll deliver must-have research through compelling client interactions and contribute to our double-digit growth by providing clients the unbiased insight and advice they need to make the right decisions every day. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration, you’ll help clients deliver on their mission-critical priorities, grow your career and increase your industry impact. We value hard workers — and reward you with unlimited opportunity. If you’re looking to explore what’s next in technology and business, Gartner is looking for you.
About TalentNeuron
TalentNeuron is the world’s leading source of global labour market supply and demand data. Our clients are well-recognized, large global enterprises and our business is succeeding and growing quickly. TalentNeuron supports a range of strategic buyers and use cases covering talent planning, recruiting, location selection, and competitive intelligence. We gather talent supply-and-demand data from more than 65,000 global sources and have an archive of billions of global job ads.
About the Role:
TalentNeuron, a part of Gartner’s HR Research & Advisory practice, is searching for a talented Data Science leader to join our Bangalore office. This person will serve as one of our key anchors for existing and incoming talent. The role requires technical competence, mentoring and extensive collaboration with the global Product Management and Information Technology teams in a fast-paced, agile development environment. This is an excellent player-coach opportunity to lead and strengthen a growing team while working closely with colleagues spread across TalentNeuron offices in the US, UK, Canada and multiple locations in India.
What you’ll do:
Lead a team of data researchers based out of Bangalore who are working on diverse and complex data challenges.
Think with a platform mindset to build reusable data sources, analytical approaches and globally-applicable models.
Be a champion for quality in all that we do; promote best-in-class quantitative methods and process documentation.
Guide the training and development of your own direct reports as well as other junior Data Scientists across the TalentNeuron business.
Inject the latest and most applicable technology, including Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, into TalentNeuron solutions.
Lead the recruiting and technical evaluation of future data research hires in the Bangalore office.
Partner with Information Technology team to drive scalability and consistency in our data collection and transformation.
Partner with Product Management and Customer Success teams to ensure data work is aligned with product plans and customer requirements.
Work side-by-side with the team on structuring and executing daily work to meet regular commitments.
Here is a sample of some data science initiatives you or your team may work on:
Estimation of salaries of job descriptions that do not contain a posted salary for any of thousands of occupations on every continent.
Time series forecasts for labour supply having a specific hard or soft skill in a certain geographic area.
Decision rules for determining whether two job ads posted on two different websites are the same or represent unique openings.
Extraction of skills, duties, education level and other details from job descriptions written in French, Spanish, Chinese, Polish and other languages.
Development and implementation of a model for estimating the supply of university graduates holding specific degrees.
Creation of an algorithm for suggesting where an employer should post a job in order to get the best response from applicants.
Development and implementation of a model for estimating the difficulty of filling a specific job role in a specific location.
What you’ll need:
BS/MS/PhD degree in a quantitatively-oriented field such as Math, Operations Research, Physical Science, Computer Science, Economics or Engineering. MBAs who meet other requirements also encouraged to apply.
A minimum of 10 years’ experience in applied analytics, preferably in multiple different business contexts and/or multiple roles.
A minimum of 2 years’ experience working with semi-structured or unstructured text data. Experience working with text data in multiple languages preferred but not required.
Ability to simplify complex projects by applying structured frameworks.
Familiarity with a wide range of analytical techniques that span traditional statistics, supervised and unsupervised machine learning, with the ability to steer and influence the work of others.
Ability to personally work in R or Python to conduct proof of concepts and review team members’ work.
Desire and ability to develop and coach junior data scientists.
Superior verbal and written communication skills.
Who you are:
A great structured thinker that can bring structure to any data science problem quickly.
A creative problem solver able to design and deliver solutions that meet stakeholder needs while powering through many constraints and dependencies.
A person with a high tolerance for managing in ambiguous situations.
A player-coach that is aware of the larger data science landscape of tools and able to use many of them.
An excellent communicator able to tailor communications to both a less technical or more technical audience so that both understand.
A leader who leans in and partners across multiple stakeholders to build alliances and deliver valuable and usable data product.
Someone who remains positive and optimistic when confronted with difficult challenges.
What we offer:
In addition to an outstanding work environment with rapid advancement potential, Gartner associates enjoy exceptional compensation and benefits, including:
A collaborative, positive culture. You’ll work with people who are as enthusiastic, smart and driven as you are.
Limitless growth and learning opportunities. We offer the excitement of a fast-paced entrepreneurial workplace and the professional growth opportunities of an established global organization.
An upbeat, positive culture. Integrity, objectivity, collaboration, results and a no-limits mind-set are central to our values.
Exposure to industry leading training and development.
Performance-based recognition and rewards.
